author: BBC News
title: Is Donald Trump's extraction of Nicolás Maduro legal? #Venezuela #NicolásMaduro #BBCNews

author: BBC News
description:
Donald Trump has issued a new threat against Venezuela, telling interim leader Delcy Rodríguez she will "pay a very big price” if she does not cooperate with the United States.   It follows the US attack on the country and seizure of its president Nicolas Maduro, who has been flown to New York to face drugs trafficking charges.

Ms Rodriguez, who served as vice-president under Mr Maduro, has publicly condemned the American operation, describing his capture as an atrocity and saying Venezuela will defend itself.   However Donald Trump said in a new interview:   “If she doesn’t do what’s right, she is going to pay a very big price, probably bigger than Maduro.”   

He had previously said that the US was going to “run Venezuela” for the time being and has repeatedly stated that the US plans to control the country’s vast oil reserves. The Trump administration has made clear that it is ready to carry out a further attack on Venezuela and  has massed a large military presence in the region.
title: Trump warns Venezuela’s new leader “do what’s right or pay a very big price” | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
Today, we look at who’s in power now in Venezuela, after President Donald Trump said the US will ‘run’ the country.

Maduro's Vice-President Delcy Rodríguez has been named interim president, who Trump says is talking to US Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

Chief political correspondent Henry Zeffman is also in the studio to talk through Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s interview with Laura in which he reacted to the news from South America, as well as his future and the UK’s relationship with the EU.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#BBCNews
title: Who's In Charge of Venezuela Now? | BBC Newscast

author: BBC News
description:
For thousands of young players, football feels like a lifelong dream, until academies release them.
 
Futures shift in an instant, leaving players to rebuild identity, find new paths, and cope with the loss of a game that once defined everything.
 
This story reveals resilience, heartbreak, and hope beyond the pitch
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
Watch more episodes of What Happens When on BBC iPlayer: https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer
 
#Football #Sport #BBCNews
title: What Happens When Football Isn’t Forever? | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
For months, US spies had been monitoring Venezuelan President's Nicolás Maduro's every move.
 
A small team, including one source within the Venezuelan government, had been observing where the 63-year-old slept, what he ate, what he wore and even, according to top military officials, "his pets".
 
Then, in early December, a planned mission dubbed "Operation Absolute Resolve" was finalised.
 
The order from US President Donald Trump to begin the mission finally came at 22:46 EST on Friday.
 
Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog 
 
For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 
 
#DonaldTrump #NicolásMaduro #Venezuela #US #BBCNews
title: How the US captured Venezuela's President Nicolas Maduro | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
The bodies of 16 more victims of a bar fire in the Swiss ski resort of Crans-Montana have been identified by police.
 
The youngest person was a Swiss girl aged 14, with nine aged under 18. The group includes people of Swiss, Italian, Romanian, Turkish and French nationalities, police said.
 
This brings the number of people identified who have been killed as a result of the fire to 24, authorities said in a statement. Eight Swiss citizens were identified on Saturday.
 
A criminal investigation into the people who ran Le Constellation bar is also under way.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news
 
#Switzerland #BBCNews
title: More victims of New Year's Eve Swiss bar fire identified by police | BBC News

author: BBC News
description:
In an exclusive interview with the BBC's Laura Kuenssberg, UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said he expects to still be the leader of the country this time next year.
 
Ahead of what is expected to be a major political year both at home and abroad, Keir Starmer was asked about the voices in his own party which questioned his leadership and the chance of a leadership challenge.
 
He also faced questions about Donald Trump, the special relationship between the UK and the US and more.

Subscribe here: http://bit.ly/1rbfUog

For more news, analysis and features visit: www.bbc.com/news 

#KeirStarmer #UKPolitics #BBCNews
title: Keir Starmer tells BBC he'll still be UK prime minister in 2027 | BBC News
